review:
Just received the Apple Ipad Air.  I have not opened it - my expectations is that it will work just great.

Know what I am really bummed about?  It says APPLE CERTIFIED REFURBISHED nicely printed on the shrink wrapped box!  I bought this for a gift, and I would have told my wife that I got a good deal on a refurbished one, but I didn't like the fact that its on the box!  They could have put the refurbished designation on a sticker, so it can be removed.  Now when she opens it at the party everyone will see APPLE CERTIFIED REFURBISHED!  I just don't feel like this is right.

We took our chances with the mixed reviews but unfortunately have to give these a big thumbs down!!!

There came a insert with the IPad asking for an honest review. So tha'st what I will give!
1) It came on date was given. Great delivery and boxing! (Box was white, not the apple box itself)
2) Opened the box and the IPad had a foam protector over the screen and well tucked into cardboard inlay. Removed and found no scratches or marks on screen or unit itself.
3) Charger was there and nothing visually wrong with it. Matched with IPad perfectly.
4) I took out and pushed the power button and it started up with 45% power on it, which was cool. I was able to use my IPhone 5s  to link up to it right away!
5) Following the on screen directions it walked me threw the whole setup process and had no problem at all. Kept my IPhone close by as certain steps it helps to have it there, since it refers back to the phone for a reply at times.
6) I added my apps no problems and was really pleased with how clear the screen was and the speed it has for doing things. Even viewing u-tube on it was a breeze for it. Installed my screen protector (Tempered Glass for IPad Air 9.7" by supershieldz) and my (Jetech IPad Air Case Wake Feature Black)
7) I am charging this IPad right now and am having no problem with the charger or tablet. Everything working as it should.

I have read the reviews before buying this myself, because I always value what you guys say about a product. And it does very much influence me in my purchases. I saw there were problems as well as good experiences, and looked like it was worth the try weighing everything out.

After a week of use the iPad started shutting itself off and wouldn't turn on.  Tried updating and factory resetting, but nothing is fixing the problem so I am returning.  I checked online and saw that other people are having this problem as well with this version of iPad.  Shame too, I wanted to keep this iPad because its exterior's condition was perfect.

Okay. I just received this item today. I really needed a new iPad but just did not want to shell out $300 for one. This one had a great price point and wasn't too old. I had an iPad 2, so this was an upgrade. I open the box expecting an Apple box, but was surprised to see the iPad in the box WITH NO PROTECTION!!!!!! The iPad was in a little plastic sleeve just loose in a large box. There was also an Apple factory charger. I was so surprised that there were no bubbles or peanuts in the box to protect it. If someone threw the box hard enough, this iPad would have been toast. When I got the iPad out, it was already turned on and it was on 72%. I was really afraid that the iPad would be damaged, but this iPad is in immaculate condition. There's not one scratch on it and it looks brand new. The charger looked used though, but that's not a big deal to me. I immediately put it into a Lifeproof Fre I purchased for it and it fit nicely. It was easy to set up and didn't have Any old info on it, which I was afraid of because of other reviews saying their iPads were still connected to the previous owner. This iPad is essentially brand new in both looks and speed. I can't rate the battery yet since I've just got it today, but I will update on it. I got the space gray IPad Air for reference. I was disappointed that this isn't an Apple certified refurbished, but I can't complain because it's in great condition and works fine. The cost was primarily the reason I bought this item.  I was a little wary at first of purchasing a certified refurbished product, especially because others had stated theirs' had arrived in unusable condition.  However, I decided that it was worth a try, especially because I have prime 2 day shipping, and if it didn't work, I would only have to wait another few days for a replacement.  When the item arrived, I was at first disappointed to see that there was some backlight screen damage; not enough to make it unusable, but it is noticeable.  After some use though, I realized that I hardly even noticed it, because it only shows when the screen is white and it's toward the top.  My guess is that the iPad was dropped, and the screen was repaired, but the backlight wasn't.  Not a huge deal, it still runs fine for being a few years old.  Overall, I've been pleasantly surprised with its performance over the past couple days, using it for mainly streaming and browsing.  If you are looking for an iPad Air in perfect condition, pay $300+ for it, but this is a great product for the price.

The device is given a good rundown to make sure it comes to you as if new from the factory.  They make sure it works exactly as it would a brand new iPad from their store with charging block and cable.

Theres nothing wrong with these devices, they all work well and they give a 90 day warranty from the day your purchase it.  So if you do find anything wrong with it they will take care of it with a replacement or your money back!  Currently using this iPad for some light gaming, email, photo editing, timelapsing, and writing this review!  If you cant afford the latest of some of their iPads, consider a recertified one that Apple has approved with these devices.  With the 90 day warranty, youd be a fool to pass up such a great offer!

I tell you, I'm tired of this. If I could give 0 stars I would. I am now going directly to Apple to purchase one of their refurbished devices. Yes, I will pay a little more, but now I feel it is worth it to get a quality working product. BUYER BEWARE!!!

I have both the iPad Air (or Air 1) and the iPad Air 2. I see no difference in most use between them, except for battery life. It is far better in the Air 1. There are issues with battery life in the Air 2, if all the internet discussion, and my own experience, on this issue is any indication,  The Air 2 is noticeably lighter in weight, and a smidgen thinner than the Air, and, in a very few high-action games, very slightly faster, but certainly not enough you would even notice if you hadn't played the same game on the Air 1 a few minutes earlier. A certified refurbished Air 1 can be had much less expensively here or directly from the Apple Store for far less than the Air 2, with the same guarantee as a new one! And it is eligible for Apple Care if you want it. I think the Air 1 is the best choice between the two, and have recommended it to 2 friends who are very happy with their purchases.
iPad Air pros and cons (compared to iPad Air 2):
Pros
  Thin enough
  Light enough
  Fast enough
  Cheaper than Air 2
  Much better battery life than Air 2
Cons
  No Touch ID (not really very useful on a tablet)

I am a Microsoft man, not an apple guy. With that being said, I purchased this as a gift for my girlfriend with pleasant satisfaction. As she already owned a Macbook and an iPhone it was the obvious choice in tablet, especially after I factored in her work on her graphic design degree.

The certified refurbished unit came in a brand new box, with factory wrap, and absolutely no nicks or scratches to speak of. There wasn't even a sticker stating it was refurbished. There was no previous owner's files or customization stored anywhere on the device. Apple is so confident in their refurbishment they even included a one-year warranty!

On to the unit itself. It came charged, she was ready to go out of the box. Initial start-up and syncing to her accounts took about 2 minutes and she was done. The screen is bright, the speakers are sufficient, and the battery life seems to stand up relatively long with constant use for gaming, movies, apps, and reading. The device is very responsive and the processing power seems instant. My only gripe about the unit is it doesn't come with screen protectors or a stylus, yet as they were not advertised as included, I cannot factor that into the score.
